physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient I.3: Birth asphyxia, hydropic, hypotonic, jaundice, transient diabetes insipidus, micropenis, bilateral cryptorchidism. Patient I.5: Prominent forehead, large anterior fontanelle, deep-set eyes, hypotonia, hypoglycemia, metabolic acidosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient I.3 diagnosed with multiple pituitary hormone deficiencies. Patient I.5 showed progressive retinal dystrophy, motor delay, and craniofacial dysmorphisms evolving over time.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient II.8: Hypertelorism, low-set ears, slight midline groove on the tongue, post-axial polydactyly, left-sided choanal atresia, partial agenesis of the corpus callosum, small anterior pituitary gland.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Height at 4.75 years was 91.2 cm (height SDS -3.2). Developmental delays noted, including inability to mobilize independently at 5.5 years.
